title: gorilla font
content:
Hi, I was wondering if anyone knew which typeface this gorilla was created with. I feel like the 'g' and 'a' may have been modified.  
I know the image quality isn't great, any help would be appreciated.  
Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420025248im_/http:/typophile.com/files/gorilla_service_logo_3650.jpg)
author: lumber

comments.content: Don't know it. Reminds me of [File](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420025248/http:/fontfabric.com/file-free-font). Anyway, your best chance is probably asking directly [Stevan](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420025248/http:/stvdesign.com/contact-2) who designed this ' [Gorilla Service](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420025248/http:/logopond.com/gallery/detail/153224)'.

The overlapping rounded terminals and weight are found in Colin Brignall's Octopuss [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/octopuss/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420025248/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/octopuss/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/octopuss/")  
Don

Another customization candidate: **[Coconut](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420025248/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=CanadaType%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Coconut%20-%20Regular&fid=cbf4f292303c420d8a1eb3eddce37c2e&fsize=60&text=gorilla&wrap=2)** by Canada Type [2006]
